snippet: Baseball tries hard to convince fans that the All-Star Game is all about effort. But mainly, players come to enjoy the spectacle and revel in their status as the best of the best.
abstract: Tyler Kepner Extra Bases column holds that MLB tries hard to convince fans that the All-Star Game is all about effort, but mainly players come to enjoy the spectacle and revel in their status as the best of the best; 2013 National and American League All-Star rosters noted.
lead_paragraph: Baseball tries hard to convince fans that the All-Star Game is all about effort. But mainly, players come to enjoy the spectacle and revel in their status as the best of the best.

headline.main: All-Star Wonder Is Not All Fun and Games
headline.print_headline: All-Star Wonder Is Not All Fun and Games
